element.title: Button
element.desc: The button tag provides a simple gray button.
element.longdescription:
Note: Redmond components are deprecated. Please consider using LZ Components. If you use this component, you must explicitly include the redmond library:
<include href="redmond"/>

Arguments:
align
default: "center"
The alignment to use for the button label. Currently either "left" or "center".

height
A number that specifies the height of the button in pixels. If no initial value is provided, the button uses the default height and becomes fixed so that future calls to change the height will not have the desired effect.

label
default: "button"
A string specifying the text to be displayed inside the button.

width
A number that specifies the width of the button in pixels.

Description:
The button tag provides a simple gray button. A button is rectangular and typically displays a text label describing its action. The button will adjust to fit the label. If you need to format the text using additional tags like <b>, add the text inside the button tags instead of using the label attribute.

Example:

<canvas height="40">
<include href="redmond"/>
<button onclick="moveHoriz(5);">
	Move <b>me</b>
	<method name="moveHoriz" args="moveAmount">
		this.setX(this.x+moveAmount);
	</method>
</button>
</canvas>

attribute.name: label
attribute.desc: The button's label text. This text can also be supplied as the content of the button element. For example, <button label="OK"/> and <button>OK</button> are equivalent. The latter syntax allows HTML markup.
